item.description:
This project from the book Kaleidoscope,(edited by Suzanne Simanaitis), has been a favorite one with our Meetup members.  I will be guiding you through the project, "Mail Art to the Self" by Juliana Coles, which is a wonderful exercise in exploring your creative process.  It's made up of  timed activities: with paint, collage, stamping, scribbling; with images, words and patterns.  It's exhilarating, hectic, inspirational, frustrating...and FUN!  It's a perfect project for those who want to free the inner child, to relinquish control, and discover their creative potential!

 

We'll provide most of the materials and tools. You will need:

* 15 glossy images (photos, pictures from magazines, etc.)

* 15 non-glossy images (pictures from old books, newspapers, puzzle books; sheet music, old maps, etc.)

 

We'd also suggest: 

* two or three favorite rubber stamps

* a good permanent black stamp pad

* scissors

* large glue stick

* brayer

* permanent marker (black sharpie or suchlike is good)

 

Even if you arrive with only some, or none of the above, we will have extra.  We'll also allow some time for you to find images from our extensive collection of old books, magazines and other ephemera.

Come and join us for an afternoon of creative enjoyment!!

 

DAY/TIME: Sunday, June 10 from 1:00 pm to ???? (Really, we'll stay as late as anybody wants to stay!) The first few hours are the most important.

AMENITIES: Free parking. Table space and a chair. Access to some tools (paper cutter, heat gun, etc.). Access to a fridge, microwave, toaster oven, kitchen sink and restroom. Dinner in or out, if people are interested.

COST: $20 to help defray the cost of Studio rental and provided materials.

WHO MAY ATTEND: Any member of the NE ATC+ Meetup and up to two guests.

HOW TO SIGN UP: These smaller sessions are often full with a waiting list. Reserve a place by RSVP-ing "yes" using Meetup's RSVP function. Please RSVP for your guests as well.

If your plans (or your guests' plans) change, PLEASE update your RSVP accordingly. Please do this right up to the start time of the event.  

WHAT TO BRING:  Your own art kit (scissors, glue sticks, x-acto knife, ruler, pencil, pens and markers) will be good to have along. (Optional) See the list above. Basic tools and supplies -- Paint, brushes, scissors, glue, tape, some rubber stamps. -- are also available for your use. Even if you show up empty-handed, we can get you started on the project. 

CANCELLATIONS: In the unlikely event that we need to cancel---or even if we're just getting a late start--we'll post a message on the Web site and e-mail everyone who's RSVP'd "yes." So to be on the safe side, please check the Web site and your inbox before departing for ArtStudio 36

group.name: New England Artist Trading Cards Plus (ATCs+) Meetup Group

item.name: "Mail Art to the Self" from the book Kaleidoscope
